com.quest.glue.api.services
Interface SystemInfoService4

All Superinterfaces:
Service
public interface SystemInfoService4
extends Service

An enhanced version of the System info service.

Since:
5.6.0

Method Detail

getCommonTopologyProvider

CommonTopologyInfo getCommonTopologyProvider()
                                             throws java.io.IOException,
                                                    java.util.concurrent.TimeoutException,
                                                    java.lang.InterruptedException
Obtains an instance of the CommonTopologyInfo class that will return values for the local system that can be used to population the common Host topology model. This includes the Host and OperatingSystem topology objects.

Returns:
A common topology object that contains the correct values to use for creating topology objects for the local system.
Throws:
java.lang.InterruptedException
java.util.concurrent.TimeoutException
java.io.IOException
Since:
5.6.7

getEnvironment

java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getEnvironment()

Returns the current OS environment values as an map of name/value pairs. Any changes made to this map will be ignored by Glue and by the OS.

Returns:
Map of environment variables

getHostDisplayName

java.lang.String getHostDisplayName()
Return the display name that is currently configured for this FglAM instance.

Returns:
This FglAM's currently configured display name

getHostID

java.util.UUID getHostID()
Return the UUID that represents this FglAM instance.

Returns:
The UUID that represents this FglAM instance

getHostname

java.lang.String getHostname()

Returns the "best" host name for the current system. "Best" is a very vague term. Every effort will be made to return a fully qualified host name, but that cannot be guaranteed.

Returns:
String hostname

getHostnames

java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getHostnames()

Returns all known host names for the current system.

Returns:
Set of string hostnames

getHostVersion

java.lang.String getHostVersion()
Returns the version of the host environment (SPID/Glue) as a String

Returns:
the version of the host, like "5.2.0"

getPlatformName

java.lang.String getPlatformName()

Returns the canonical platform name for this system. Something like "windows-ia32" or "linux-powerpc". The canonical list of platform names is defined by the Glue core team and is based in the Java system properties "os.name" and "os.platform"

The current mapping from system property to platform name can be found in the Glue Devlopers's Kit manual.

Returns:
String platform name

getSystemID

java.lang.String getSystemID()
The unique system ID for the current system, or null if the system ID could not be determined. This ID is for the system on which the agent is running, not necessarily the system being monitored.

Returns:
the unique system ID for the current system, or null

is32Bit

boolean is32Bit()

True if this class was loaded in a 32-bit VM and false if it was not.

Returns:
True if VM is 32 bit

is64Bit

boolean is64Bit()

True if this class was loaded in a 64-bit VM and false if it was not.

Returns:
True if vm is 64 bit

isSystem32Bit

boolean isSystem32Bit()
Determines if the host operating system is 32-bit or 64-bit. This may differ from the value of is32Bit() if the VM and the host operating system have different bitnesses.

Returns:
true if the host operating system is 32-bit and false if it is not.

isSystem64Bit

boolean isSystem64Bit()
Determines if the host operating system is 32-bit or 64-bit. This may differ from the value of is64Bit() if the VM and the host operating system have different bitnesses.

Returns:
true if the host operating system is 64-bit and false if it is not.

isUnix

boolean isUnix()
Whether or not the current platform is Unix-like. This includes Linux, AIX, HP-UX, Solaris, etc.

Returns:
true if the current platform is Unix and false if it is not.

isWindows

boolean isWindows()
Whether or not the current platform is any version of Windows. This includes 2000, XP, 2003, Vista, etc.

Returns:
true if the current platform is Windows and false if it is not.
